claim.text: AutoAIS is fit-for-purpose as a development metric at the aggregate level.
claim.exact_quote: AutoAIS is fit-for-purpose as a development metric at the aggregate level (provided it is not used as a system component).

evidence.evidence_text: Strong correlation between system AIS and AutoAIS scores, with a Pearson coefficient of 0.96
evidence.limitations: Correlation may not hold at the instance level
evidence.exact_quote: Correlation between system AIS and AutoAIS scores is remarkably strong, with a Pearson coefficient of 0.96 (Figure 3).

evaluation.justification: AutoAIS shows a strong correlation with human evaluation of AIS at the system level, indicating its potential as a development metric.
evaluation.key_limitations: May not be reliable at the instance level

claim.text: Retrieve-then-read approaches achieve the strongest performance on the evaluation.
claim.exact_quote: Retrieve-then-read approaches achieve the strongest performance on our evaluation, but require full use of a traditional training set.

evidence.evidence_text: Table 2 shows that Retrieve-then-read (RTR) systems consistently achieve higher AIS scores compared to post-hoc retrieval systems
evidence.limitations: Evaluation is based on a specific dataset (Natural Questions) and may not generalize to other tasks or datasets

evaluation.justification: Empirical results demonstrate that retrieve-then-read systems outperform post-hoc retrieval systems in terms of AIS scores.
evaluation.key_limitations: Generalizability to other datasets and tasks is uncertain

claim.text: Post-hoc attribution appears to be a viable architecture for future work, but remains challenging.
claim.exact_quote: Post-hoc attribution appears to be a viable architecture for future work, but remains challenging.

evidence.evidence_text: Post-hoc retrieval systems achieve lower AIS scores than retrieve-then-read systems
evidence.limitations: Results may vary depending on the specific post-hoc retrieval approach and dataset used

evaluation.justification: While post-hoc attribution shows promise, it faces challenges in achieving performance comparable to retrieve-then-read approaches.
evaluation.key_limitations: Feasibility and effectiveness may vary depending on the implementation and dataset
